comments.body: What if the test runs during daylight saving time? So, the diff can be 1 hour.
only test it on UTC then?

If the execution time is 8ms, the chance to hit daylight saving time is less than 8/(365 * 24 * 3600 * 1000)..The operation should be finished in 1 second. I can filter "PST" and "LA" if you really want to avoid it. WDYT?
There is only a momentary chance of reaching daylight saving time every year.
Actually the current_timestamp test has the same DST issue and the test is working pretty well. It should be fine.
@MaxGekk since you insist, I created https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/33354 to address your comment.
